question: If <katex>$A=\begin{bmatrix}2-k&2\\ 1&3-k\end{bmatrix}$</katex> is singular matrix, then the value of <katex>$5k-k^{2}$</katex> is equal to
explanation: For a singular matrix, the determinant is zero.
From the equation, <katex>$k^2 - 5k = -4$</katex>, so <katex>$-(k^2 - 5k) = 4$</katex>, which means <katex>$5k - k^2 = 4$</katex>.
